title:
Will Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) Outperform the Rest of the Stocks in the 
Communication Services Sector?
text:
Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) is around the top of the Communication Services sector according to InvestorsObserver.

GOOG received an overall rating of 80, which means that it scores higher than 80% of stocks. Additionally, Alphabet Inc Class C scored a 95 in the Communication Services sector, ranking it higher than 95% of stocks in that sector.





 GOOG has an Overall Score of 80. Find out what this means to you and get the rest of the rankings on GOOG!
See Full GOOG Report


What do These Ratings Mean?

Analyzing stocks can be hard. There are tons of numbers and ratios, and it can be hard to remember what they all mean and what counts as “good” for a given value. InvestorsObserver ranks stocks on eight different metrics. We percentile rank most of our scores to make it easy for investors to understand. A score of 80 means the stock is more attractive than 80 percent of stocks. 

These rankings allows you to easily compare stocks and view what the strengths and weaknesses are of a given company. This lets you find the stocks with the best short and long term growth prospects in a matter of seconds.

The combined score incorporates technical and fundamental analysis in order to give a comprehensive overview of a stocks performance. Investors who then want to focus on analysts rankings or valuations are able to see the separate scores for each section.



What's Happening With Alphabet Inc Class C Stock Today?

Alphabet Inc Class C (GOOG) stock is trading at $152.07 as of  12:48 PM on Thursday, Mar 28, a rise of $0.13, or 0.09% from the previous closing price of $151.94. Volume today is below average. So far 6,010,019 shares have traded  compared to average volume of 25,146,531 shares. The stock has traded between  $151.33 and $152.55 so far today.
